thread.title: H.S. soccer roundup: East Lyme junior sets single-season program scoring record in win
thread.title_full: H.S. soccer roundup: East Lyme junior sets single-season program scoring record in win

author: The Bulletin sports@norwichbulletin.com
title: H.S. soccer roundup: East Lyme junior sets single-season program scoring record in win
text: • GALLERY: Fitch girls soccer at Bacon Academy EAST LYME — Stephanie deLaforcade scored twice and set the school’s single-season scoring record with her 27th goal as East Lyme finished the regular season with a 7-0 victory over Norwich Free Academy on Wednesday. Izzy Moore had two goals and two assists and Theresa Durkee added a goal and two assists for East Lyme (15-1, 9-1 ECC Large). Kayla Tosses made 13 saves for the Wildcats (3-12, 2-8). Tourtellotte 1 Griswold 0 JEWETT CITY — Maegan Roy scored in the second half and Tourtellotte won its fourth straight game. Emily Vincent made five saves to earn the shutout for the Tigers (10-3-1, 6-2-1 Eastern Connecticut Conference Small Division). Brianna Becotte made six saves for the Wolverines (7-7-1, 5-5-1). Woodstock 1 Ledyard 0 WOODSTOCK — Ivy Gelhaus scored six minutes into the game and the Centaurs held on to snap a three-game losing streak. Kennedy Davignon made 10 saves to earn the shutout and Makara Sorel assisted on the goal for Woodstock (7-7-1, 5-4-1 ECC Large). Delaney Gagnon made five saves for the Colonels (10-4, 6-3). Putnam 5 Parish Hill 0 PUTNAM — Morgan Foucault had three goals and an assist and the Clippers stayed unbeaten in the Constitution State Conference East with the win. Jaidyn Gillette had two goals and two assists for Putnam (7-7, 6-0). Dakota Anderson made six saves in the win. The Pirates are 9-8, 3-4. Montville 3 Killingly 0 MONTVILLE — Rachel Marchini scored all of Montville’s goals to lead the Indians to the ECC Medium win. Madison Beaupre had two assists and Lauren Ross made six saves for the shutout for Montville (4-8-2, 2-5-1). Jamie Jax had five saves for the Redgals (9-6, 3-5). Bacon 7 Fitch 0 COLCHESTER — Molly Kelly and Kim Lizotte each had a pair of goals in the second half and the Bobcats scored six times after halftime in the ECC Large win. Courtney Downer had a goal and an assist, Leah Beauton converted a penalty kick and Lizotte added an assist for Bacon (8-4-2, 6-2-1). The Falcons are 0-13-1, 0-10. Nor. Tech-Holy Fam. 8 Public Safety 1 NORWICH — Allie Smith and Ashlee Cardin each scored two goals and the Warriors scored four times in each half in the win. Emily Kivela had a goal and an assist for Norwich Tech-Holy Family (8-5). Plainfield 3 Waterford 3 (2 OT) WATERFORD — The Panthers scored three second-half goals to come back from a two-goal halftime deficit and run their unbeaten streak to five games. Julie Jordan scored twice for Plainfield (9-5-1, 3-4-1 ECC Medium). Claire Hurley scored a goal and Mia Brennan had two assists for the Lancers (11-2-2, 5-1-2). Page 2 of 2 - Stonington 3 Old Lyme 1 OLD LYME — Halle Anderson netted a pair of goals to lift the Bears to their third consecutive win. Sam Narducci scored and had an assist for Stonington (11-4). Pomfret 2 Tabor 1 POMFRET — Sydney Fisher had a goal and an assist to lead the Griffins to their third straight win. Meaghan Haley made 10 saves for Pomfret (6-1). St. Luke’s 2 Marianapolis 1 MARIANAPOLIS — Caroline Soucy finished a corner kick from Emily Sheridan to cut the lad to one but the Golden Knights failed to score the equalizer and had their five-game win streak halted. Jordan Desaulnier made eight saves for Marianapolis (9-2-1). Williams 2 Watkinson 1 NEW LONDON — Camryn Werbinski scored with six minutes left in regulation and the Blues finished off the comeback win. Bella Griscom also scored for Williams (5-3-1). BOYS Wilb. & Monson 5 Marianapolis 4 MARIANAPOLIS — Drew Collari scored two goals, including a penalty kick, and added two assists in the Golden Knights’ loss. Yoshimasa Fujikawa and Andrew Ford also scored for Marianapolis (4-4-2). Berkshire 8 Pomfret 0 SHEFFIELD, Mass. — Jack Bacon made nine saves, but the Griffins allowed six first-half goals in the loss to the perennial Class A power. Pomfret is 5-2-4. St. Andrew’s 9 Williams 0 BARRINGTON, R.I. — The Blues held the defending New England champs scoreless for the first 25 minutes. Alex Bowdler made 15 saves for Williams (1-9-2). Chase Collegiate 6 St. Thomas More 0 MONTVILLE — Chengzhi Young made 12 saves in the Chancellors’ loss. St. Thomas More fell to 0-6. By The Bulletin
